results.abstract: Article on efforts to provide greater safety on ski lifts (M)

headline.main: Safety on Ski Lifts Being Upgraded

results.snippet: BOULDER, Colo., Dec. 2 Ever since New Hampshire instituted compulsory state government lift inspections more than 15 years ago, the movement to provide greater uphill ride safety for skiers has broadened.

byline.original: By MICHAEL STRAUSS Special to The New York Times

results.lead_paragraph: BOULDER, Colo., Dec. 2 Ever since New Hampshire instituted compulsory state government lift inspections more than 15 years ago, the movement to provide greater uphill ride safety for skiers has broadened.

results.abstract: US Appeals Ct for Third Circuit dismisses for 2d time $500,000 lawsuit brought by former Phila Asst Dist Atty Richard Sprague against former superior F Emmett Fitzpatrick; Sprague argued that Fitzpatrick violated his First and 14th Amendment rights when he dismissed him in Dec '74 (S)

headline.main: Army Is Said to Plan Transfer of General From West Point Job; Army to Shift West Point General

results.snippet: The Army is planning quietly to transfer Brig. Gen. Walter F. Ulmer, the Commandant of Cadets at the United States Military Academy during its recent cheating scandal, sources in the Pentagon said last night.
results.lead_paragraph: The Army is planning quietly to transfer Brig. Gen. Walter F. Ulmer, the Commandant of Cadets at the United States Military Academy during its recent cheating scandal, sources in the Pentagon said last night.

headline.main: West Point Cadets, by Close Vote, Bar Flexible Honor-Code Penalty; West Point Cadets, by a Close Vote, Bar Flexible Honor-Code Penalty

results.snippet: WEST POINT, N.Y. Dec. 10 The Corps of Cadets has voted to retain expulsion as the single and automatic penalty for violation of the honor code of the United States Military Academy here.

results.lead_paragraph: WEST POINT, N.Y. Dec. 10 The Corps of Cadets has voted to retain expulsion as the single and automatic penalty for violation of the honor code of the United States Military Academy here.

results.abstract: US Mil Acad Corps of Cadets, 2,523-1,295, votes to retain automatic explusion as single penalty for Honor Code violations; Ulmer says he is being transferred; neither Acad nor Defense Dept officials will say if he is being removed because of his handling of cheating scandal (M)

results.abstract: C L Sulzberger article on likelihood that US airlines and airplane mfrs may have to organize cartel to insure end to competition on construction of new generation of air transports to make new airplanes affordable to airlines; cites study by former Air Force Asst Sec Robert H Charles, who believes that billions of dollars would be saved if only 1 basic model is built; holds modern times impose need for new econ methods to survive (M)
results.snippet: BRUSSELS Not only does the NATO alliance find itself in a financial disarray of duplication and rivalry in the arms production of its various member countries (as cited in a column last month) but the great civilian airlines, staggering under the...
results.lead_paragraph: BRUSSELS Not only does the NATO alliance find itself in a financial disarray of duplication and rivalry in the arms production of its various member countries (as cited in a column last month) but the great civilian airlines, staggering under the mounting cost of aviation fuel and the uncertainty of traffic loads, seem on the verge of facing the need to stop buying differing types of planes from differing manufacturers.

results.abstract: Brig Gen John C Bard succeeding Ulmer; biog sketch; illus (M)

headline.main: HAIG AIDE IS NAMED CHIEF AT WEST POINT; Gen. Bard, Who Succeeds Ulmer Held the Top Undergraduate Rank at Academy

results.snippet: WEST POINT, Dec. 13 Brig. Gen. John C. Bard today was named today commandant of cadets at the United States Military Academy, where he once held the rank of first captain, or top cadet.

results.lead_paragraph: WEST POINT, Dec. 13 Brig. Gen. John C. Bard today was named today commandant of cadets at the United States Military Academy, where he once held the rank of first captain, or top cadet.

headline.main: BORMAN PANEL URGES CADETS' READMISSION; Handling of Cheating at West Point Attacked in Army Report Borman's Panel Asks Readmission Of the Cadets in Cheating Scandal

results.snippet: WASHINGTON, Dec. 14 A select commission headed by a former astronaut, Frank Borman, has urged a speedy readmission of all cadets who left the United States Military Academy at West Point, N.Y., under the cloud of the worst cheating scandal in its...
results.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Dec. 14 A select commission headed by a former astronaut, Frank Borman, has urged a speedy readmission of all cadets who left the United States Military Academy at West Point, N.Y., under the cloud of the worst cheating scandal in its history, sources in the Defense Department said today.

results.abstract: Hoffmann to act on recommendations by special com that cadets involved in cheating scandal be reinstated as soon as possible; refuses to confirm whether cadets will be reinstated, but says he agrees with com's conclusions that acad deserves as much blame for honor code violations as cadets; com's recommendations revd (M)

headline.main: SECRETARY OF ARMY WILL ACT ON CADETS; But Hoffmann Does Not Confirm He Intends to Order Reinstatement of West Point Students

results.snippet: WASHINGTON, Dec. 15 Secretary of the Army Martin R. Hoffmann indicated today that he would act within a few weeks on recommendations by a special commission that cadets involved in the United States Military Academy's cheating scandal be reinstated...

byline.original: By JAMES FERON Special to The New York Times

results.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Dec. 15 Secretary of the Army Martin R. Hoffmann indicated today that he would act within a few weeks on recommendations by a special commission that cadets involved in the United States Military Academy's cheating scandal be reinstated as soon as possible.

results.snippet: The cheating scandal that led to the expulsion of 139 cadets from the United States Military Academy has from its very start told more about West Point's  deficiencies as an academic institution than about alleged flaws in the character of the...
results.lead_paragraph: The cheating scandal that led to the expulsion of 139 cadets from the United States Military Academy has from its very start told more about West Point's deficiencies as an academic institution than about alleged flaws in the character of the cadets. By rigidly standing behind an honor code that seemed blind to human behavior, the traditionalists, including many of the cadets, have demonstrated an unfortunate lack of understanding of pedagogy, justice and honor itself.

results.abstract: W Safire article holding liberal politicians are accepting myth when they believe big businessmen are 'hard-nosed conservatives'
results.snippet: WASHINGTON, Dec. 15 Meeting Bert Lance, who is to be the Carter Administration's chief budget officer, for the first time last week, I narrowly resisted the impulse to reach out and squeeze his nose.
results.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Dec. 15 Meeting Bert Lance, who is to be the Carter Administration's chief budget officer, for the first time last week, I narrowly resisted the impulse to reach out and squeeze his nose.

results.abstract: 23 members of freshman class of 95th Cong are attending wk-long orientation course jointly sponsored by Harvard Univ's Inst of Pols and Cong Research Service of Library of Cong; all newly elected Cong members were invited to attend free program, which ends on Dec 17; lecturers include Profs Otto Eckstein, Edwin O Reischauer and John K Fairbanks and Rashi Fein and Martin Feldstein; some newly-elected Cong members comment; illus of Sen-elect Hayakawa and Barbara A Mikulski on way to meeting (L)

headline.main: Congressional Freshmen Return to School; 23 Spend Week at Harvard in Preparation for Their First Term in Capital

results.snippet: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Dec. 17 Trooping across the snow-covered Harvard Yard in their blue jeans, sweaters and duffle coats, some of them looked like graduate students in the tow of an amiable professor.

byline.original: By MARTIN TOLCHIN Special to The New York Times

results.abstract: Cartoon Opera Minstrel Theater: Comment on theater, headed by Patrick and Heather McDermott; theater uses narrative story-songs that use music and spoken word, adding mime and dance; illus (M)
results.snippet: HEATHER and Patrick McDermott say they are creating what is essentially a new theatrical experience, a per  forming-arts genre that enlivens a combination of traditional story lines and fables with song, dance, mime, music and the spoken word. They...
results.lead_paragraph: HEATHER and Patrick McDermott say they are creating what is essentially a new theatrical experience, a per forming-arts genre that enlivens a combination of traditional story lines and fables with song, dance, mime, music and the spoken word. They have named their enterprise--which has attracted the prestigious support of the National Endowment for the Arts-- the Cartoon opera Minstrel Theater.

headline.main: Hackensack to Hear; Rare Opera Group

results.snippet: HEATHER and Patrick McDermott say they are creating what is essentially a new theatrical experience, a per  forming arts genre that brings a combination of traditional story lines and fables to life with song, dance, mime, music and the spoken word....
results.lead_paragraph: HEATHER and Patrick McDermott say they are creating what is essentially a new theatrical experience, a per forming arts genre that brings a combination of traditional story lines and fables to life with song, dance, mime, music and the spoken word. They have named their enterprise--which has attracted the prestigious support of the National Endowment for the Arts-- the Cartoon Opera Minstrel Theater.

results.abstract: unidentified ousted cadet says most guilty colleagues would return to acad if given option (M)

headline.main: Ex-West Point Cadet Says Most of Ousted Wish to Come Back

results.snippet: A West Point cadet ousted in the academy's cheating scandal said yesterday that 88 of 94 former fellow cadets surveyed by telephone Sunday had indicated they would return next month if given the option. A total of 151 cadets were implicated.
results.lead_paragraph: A West Point cadet ousted in the academy's cheating scandal said yesterday that 88 of 94 former fellow cadets surveyed by telephone Sunday had indicated they would return next month if given the option. A total of 151 cadets were implicated.

headline.main: Sports Medicine Shares In East German Success; Sports Medicine Plays a Key Behind-the-Scenes Role in East Germany

results.snippet: LEIPZIG, East Germany "Behind every Olympic gold medal," said an East German doctor who was standing figuratively behind 40 of them from last summer's Games in Montreal, "there is an entire collective of doctors, technicians and coaches just like...

byline.original: By CRAIG R. WHITNEY Special to The New York Times

results.lead_paragraph: LEIPZIG, East Germany "Behind every Olympic gold medal," said an East German doctor who was standing figuratively behind 40 of them from last summer's Games in Montreal, "there is an entire collective of doctors, technicians and coaches just like mission control when an astronaut is sent up into space."

results.abstract: Ulmer says he was unfairly treated in cheating scandal (M)

headline.main: General Ousted From West Point Charges He Was Treated Unfairly; Links Problems to a Remark

results.snippet: WEST POINT, N.Y., Dec. 28 (AP)--Brig. Gen. Walter F. Ulmer Jr., ousted commandant of cadets at the United States-Military Academy, says he was unfairly treated in the Academy's cheating scandal.
results.lead_paragraph: WEST POINT, N.Y., Dec. 28 (AP)--Brig. Gen. Walter F. Ulmer Jr., ousted commandant of cadets at the United States-Military Academy, says he was unfairly treated in the Academy's cheating scandal.
